intro: Myosotis goyenii, commonly known as the New Zealand forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences. Myosotis goyenii is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
